The aftermath, of a Grand Prix Attack. Better is 8. ... c4+ 9. Kh1 h5...
moves.9... Nfe7 10. d3 h5 11. g5 Nf5 12. h4: So far so good, in this Sicilian gone astray... White succeeded in turning it into Dutch Defense with white... Mind you, this is blitz... Whites last move - to prevent a black h4 - looks solid, but might not be best. Black is better here, after Nce7-g6 white has problems...
moves.12... Be7 13. Bh3 f6 14. Bxf5 exf5 15. g: White calls the bluff, all the way... 16. ... Rg8+ 17. Kh1 fxe5 18. fex5 0-0-0, is fine...
moves.16... O-O-O 17. b3 c4+ 18. Be3 Bc5: Of course, 18. ... cxd3, 19. Qxd3 (or first Rhg8+, Kh1) is totally winning for black...
moves.19. d4: Fearless. We hold an equal position... After 19. ... Be7, bxc4, Rg8+, Kh2, Na5, exf6!
moves.19... Nxd4: Black is getting cranky, over whites resistance, and blunders...
moves.20. Nxd4: In the spur of the moment, white blunders back. 20. cxd4, or even Bxd4, is of course totally winning for white now, but I got mixed up... Now, with Nf3 gone, black can release most of whites tensions with 20. ... fxe5, fxe5, Rde8...
moves.20... Bxd4: Black produces his third blunder in a row... 20. ... fxe5, still holds...
moves.21. Bxd4: And black resigns... There is a crack in everything, that's how the light gets in... In the end, chess is pure luck...

gameName: There is a crack in everything; that's how the light gets in
